DOC.brief_summary: Oxygen radicals and inflammation are important causes for brain injury in neonates following perinatal asphyxia. Animal studies demonstrated potential benefits to the brain when using both of vitamin C and ibuprofen. The efficacy of these 2 drugs when combined in protecting the human brain has not been studied. We aimed in this study to test the hypothesis that a combination of anti-oxidants (vitamin C) and anti-inflammatory (ibuprofen) drugs can decrease the brain injury in perinatal asphyxia and improve outcomes when given to infants immediately after birth.
DOC.brief_title: Ascorbic Acid and Ibuprofen in Infants With Hypoxic Ischemic Encephalopathy
DOC.criteria: Apgar score at 5 minutes < 6 Profound metabolic or mixed acidosis with pH < 7 in the initial blood gas Evidence of encephalopathy such as coma, seizures or hypotonia Evidence of multisystem compromise, in addition to encephalopathy Major congenital anomalies Early sepsis Gastrointestinal bleeding Thrombocytopenia
